CatDescriptText: Harry Hodge, janitor, Schenley Heights and Mr. Wilk, Manchester, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, July 23, 1960, pg. A1 with question: "What do you think is the number one problem for city officials to solve in the redevelopment program?  Why?"  Mr. Hodge's answer reads: "I think that the redevelopers should make certain that all persons have an equal share in jobs, housing, and every part of the redevelopment."  Mr. Wilk's answer reads: "I think that redevelopers should concentrate on the outlying areas of the city, like the Manchester District where they have already begun."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Harry Hodge wearing dark suit jacket, eyeglasses, and hat, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown; Portrait of Mr. Wilk wearing striped necktie, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
